InfoText: After finishing this lesson,  you will be able to...
[ sell air segments from a flight availability display.
[ sell connecting flights in the same class.
[ sell connecting flights in different classes.
<PgDn>
The entry code SS^ is used to book an air segment from an availability display,
as follows:
SS1Y1^
This entry will sell 1 seat in Y class on the flight in line 1 of the display.
To demonstrate,  display neutral availability on 12 June from FRA to NCE."

TerminalText: AF3113  Y9 S9 K9 Q9 V9 X9 GR  GVA   NCE 1 1055   1145   0/CRJ       2:55
InfoText: The following entry will book 1 seat in C class on the flight that departs
SS1C2^
Input this entry.
Each flight reservation is represented by an air segment. The digit 1
indicates the first element of the reservation.
<PgDn>
The following entry will remove the reservation from the agent's work space
without storing the information:
IG^
This action is called ignoring the transaction. Input this entry."
Now display neutral availability on 21 April from ZRH to VIE.

InfoText: Book 1 seat in Y class on the OS flight that arrives in Vienna at 1035.
Input the entry to ignore the transaction.
Assume a client plans to travel on 31 August from Barcelona to Paris.
Display neutral availability for all local airports.

TerminalText: 2   IB4422  C9 Y9 L9 W9 Q5 TL     BCN B ORY S 0725   0905   0/M87       1:40
6   AF1127  C9 Z2 Y9 S9 KL HL TL  BCN A CDG2D 1620   1810   0/320       1:50
InfoText: Assume the client prefers the Air France flight departing at 1325. Book
a reservation for 2 passengers in Y class.
The air segment contains information about the flight reservation. The
segment number indicates the order in the itinerary.
<PgDn>
Each flight segment shows the airline code,  flight number,  and class. This
reservation is booked on Air France flight 1159 in Y class.
<PgDn>
The departure date is shown after the booking class. This reservation is
booked for 31 August. The digit after the date indicates the day of the week.
The digit 3 indicates that the flight departs on Wednesday.
<PgDn>
The board point and off point are displayed after the date. This flight
departs from Barcelona and arrives at Charles de Gaulle.
<PgDn>
The segment status is displayed before the number of seats. The status code HK^
indicates that the reservation is confirmed.
<PgDn>
The local departure time and arrival time are displayed after the number of
seats. This flight will depart from Barcelona at 1325 and arrive at Charles
de Gaulle at 1515.
<PgDn>
In this Air France segment,  the latest check-in time and the departure
terminal are shown before the departure time. Passengers are advised to
check in no later than 1255 at terminal A.
<PgDn>
The equipment code,  number of stops,  and meal code are displayed after
the flight times.
<PgDn>
Any applicable service information is displayed on the line directly below
the air segment. In this example,  AF 1159 will arrive at Terminal 2D. Input
the entry to ignore the transaction.
Now display neutral availability on 14 March from Munich to all London
airports.
Book 4 seats in H class on the flight that departs at 1030.
In this segment,  the status code HK4^ indicates that 4 seats are now confirmed.
Input the entry to ignore the transaction.
Display neutral availability on 18 November from Copenhagen to Nice.

TerminalText: 2:  LH6959  C4 Z4 H4 V4 L4 B4 G4  CPH I MUC   0855   1035   0/M87
3   SK 601  C9 S9 M9 B9 H9 V9 Q9  CPH I ZRH B 0855   1040   0/M80
InfoText: Book 2 seats in M class on the direct flight.
The status code SS^ indicates that the reservation will be confirmed when
the transaction is ended. Segments have this status if the airline is not
an AMADEUS Access carrier. Assume the passengers will return on 24 November.
Display return availability.

TerminalText: 2*SRLX3751  C9 ZR Y9 M9 L9 H9 K9  NCE 1 ZRH A 1725   1840   0.AR1
*SRLX3402  C9 Z9 Y9 M9 L9 H9 K9  ZRH A CPH I 1915   2055   0.AR1       3:30
3*SRLX3757  C9 Z9 Y9 M9 L9 H9 K9  NCE 1 GVA M 1035   1130   0.AR1
BTSK 112  C9 S9 M9 B9 G9 V9     GVA   CPH I 1230   1425   0/ARJ       3:50
InfoText: The following entry is used to book connecting flight segments in the
same class:
SS2M2^
This example will book 2 seats in M class on the flights in line 2. Input
this entry.
The text SEE^ RTSVC^ indicates that more than one line of service information
applies. The service information may be displayed as follows:
RTSVC^
Input this entry.
Ignore the transaction.
Display neutral availability on 22 November from MAD to PHX.

TerminalText: 2   DL 109  F7 C7 D7 Y7 B7 M7 K7  MAD I ATL   1430   1735   0.L15
3   DL 109  F7 C7 D7 Y7 B7 M7 K7  MAD I ATL   1430   1735   0.L15
InfoText: The following entry is used to book connecting flight segments in different
classes:
SS2CF2^
This example will book 2 seats in C class on DL 109 and in F class on DL 345.
Input this entry.
Ignore the transaction.
Display neutral availability on 18 October from EDI to ROM.

TerminalText: 3   SN 696  C9 Y9 M9 L9 K9 T9 QL  EDI   BRU   0635   0915   0/146
InfoText: Book 2 seats in M class on BD 067 and in D class on BA 556.
Ignore the transaction.
